description: Demolition of existing bungalow and garage and erection of new two storey, two-bed detached dwelling house.
decision_conditions: The proposed development, by virtue of its size, scale and sitting would be detrimental to the amenities of the adjoining occupiers at 28 and 30 Park Lane, by reason of overdominance, overshadowing, visual intrusion, loss of light and loss of outlook. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to policies DMHD 1 and DMHB 11 of the Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).

The proposed development by reason of side facing windows of bedrooms 1 and 2 and their proximity to the neighbouring properties at No.28 and 30 would result in a form of development which would not provide satisfactory amenities for that adjoining properties, due to the loss of privacy that could arise. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy DMHD 1 , DMHB 11 of the Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020).

The proposal would provide three habitable rooms (bedrooms 1 and 2 at ground floor and bedroom 3 at first floor) with no or very poor outlook and daylight and sunlight and would therefore give rise to a substandard form of living accommodation to the detriment of the amenity of future occupiers. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies DMHD 1 and DMHB 11 of the Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021

The proposed development, by reason of its siting, size, scale, bulk, height and design, would be detrimental to the character, appearance and visual amenities of the street scene and would fail to either preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the surrounding Harefield Village Conservation Area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 4, DMHB 11 and DMHB 12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF.

The proposed development would, by virtue of its failure to maintain an adequate amount of private usable external amenity space for the occupiers of the property, result in an over-development of the site which would be detrimental to the residential amenity of future occupiers. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy DMHB 18 of the Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020)

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies from the 'Saved' UDP 2007, Local Plan Part 1, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service.  A pre-application advice was sought which was objected on 10/7/20.   As such, the applicant would have been aware of the previous reasons for refusal.
